io.spine.server.entity.storage

Class ColumnTypeRegistry<C extends ColumnType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.server.entity.storage.ColumnTypeRegistry<C>
  • Type Parameters:
    C - storage-specific implementation of the ColumnType

    public final class ColumnTypeRegistry<C extends ColumnType>
extends java.lang.Object
    A registry of type conversion strategies for the entity columns.

    To register new Class to ColumnType mapping, do the following: 

         
         final VarcharDateType varcharType = new VarcharDateType();
         final ColumnTypeRegistry registry = ColumnTypeRegistry.newBuilder()
                                                               .put(Date.class, varcharType)
                                                               .build();

         MyJdbcBasedStorageFactory.newBuilder()
                                  // ...
                                  .setColumnTypeRegistry(registry)
                                  .build();

    To retrieve the ColumnType instance (in case if you implement your own Storage), call ColumnTypeRegistry.get(EntityColumn) on the column which you'd like to retrieve the type for.

    Note: in the example above, if you try to get the type for a EntityColumn of for example a class java.sql.Timestamp which extends Date unless you specify a ColumnType for java.sql.Timestamp explicitly, the same value as for the class Date will be returned. Thus, the ColumnType of a parent class can be used for a derived class. But be aware since the interfaces are not supported within this feature.

    If several ColumnTypes are written under a single Class object, the latest put overrides all the previous ones.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public C get(EntityColumn field)
        Retrieves the ColumnType for the specified EntityColumn.

        By default, this method returns the ColumnType for the column's type.

        If the ColumnType was not found by the class of the EntityColumn, its superclasses are checked one by one until a ColumnType is found or until the look up reaches the class representing Object.

        If no ColumnType is found, an IllegalStateException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        field - the EntityColumn to get type conversion strategy for
        Returns:
        the ColumnType for the given EntityColumn

      • newBuilder
